summary: This bill, the 'Commission to Study and Develop Reparation Proposals for African Americans Act', establishes a 15-member commission to investigate the institution of slavery from 1619-1865 and its ongoing legacy. The commission will study historical and continuing discrimination against African Americans, including economic, educational, and health disparities. It is required to report its findings to Congress within 18 months, recommending appropriate remedies. These remedies may include a formal national apology, policy changes to address systemic inequities, and proposals for calculating and distributing potential compensation to the descendants of enslaved people.
